children.name: advantage b1
children.definition: advantagea good feature of something, for example a way in which it is useful or better than other things of the same kind: lợi ích, tác dụng
examples: there are different ways of saving money for retirement, but this one has several advantages:
advantage of
one of the many advantages of living in new york is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
the advantage of walking to work is that i get some exercise:
advantage over
this printer has several advantages over conventional printers.
big advantageone of the big advantages of the course is that it helps students develop their writing skills in english:

children.name: the good thing u
children.definition: the good/great/best thing about somethingespecially spokenused when mentioning a good feature of something. this phrase is rather informal and you should not use it in formal essays :
examples: the good thing about this job is that i can work at home whenever i want.

children.name: benefit b1
children.definition: benefit a feature of something that has a good effect on people’s lives :
examples: regular exercise has many benefits, including reducing the risk of heart disease.
benefit of
the benefits of contact lenses
i never had the benefit of a university education.
the new credit cards willbe ofgreatbenefitto our customers.
i hope that the decision taken today willbe to the benefit ofthe whole nation.
for sb’s benefit
could you just explain again for mark’s benefit?
without the benefit of something
most motorists manage without the benefit of four-wheel drive.
have the benefit of somethingall the hotel rooms have the benefit of a balcony.
get a benefit(alsogain/derive a benefitformal)in this way, students will gain maximum benefit from their classes.
enjoy the benefitsyou’ll enjoy all the benefits of being a member.
reap the benefits(= enjoy the advantages of something you have worked hard to get )he was looking forward to reaping the benefits of all his hard work.
bring/provide benefitsthe new bridge has brought considerable benefits.
something outweighs the benefits(= something is more important than the benefits )make sure that the risks don’t outweigh the benefits.
a great/major/substantial benefitthe new system will be a great benefit to the company.
a real benefitto get some real benefit from the exercise, you should continue for at least half an hour.
a direct benefitthe money sent has been of direct benefit to the islanders.
a lasting benefitthese plans are likely to result in lasting benefit to the whole of our district.
the full benefit of somethingthey will have the full benefit of our facilities.
economic/social/environmental etc benefitstourism has brought considerable economic benefits to the island.
health benefitsjust 30 minutes of moderate daily activity yields health benefits.
mutual benefit(= something good for both people, companies etc involved )our two companies are working together for mutual benefit.
potential benefitsthe potential benefits of the scheme must be weighed against the costs involved.
for your own benefithe used the money for his own benefit, instead of using it to help other people.

children.name: merit x
children.definition: merit a good feature that something has, which you consider when you are deciding whether it is the best choice:mặt lợi, lợi ích
examples: ▪ the merits of the new health programme are gradually being recognized:
▪ the committee is still considering the merits of the new proposals:
merit of
the merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
register meritis used especially in formal contexts. in everyday english, people usually talk about thegood pointsof something:
the book does have itsgood points.
have meritboth suggestions had some merit.
discuss/debate the merits of something(= discuss whether or not something is a good idea )they were discussing the merits of sending soldiers to the area.
consider/judge the merits of something(= think about whether or not something is a good idea )the committee is considering the merits of the proposal.
assess/evaluate the merits of something(= to decide what is good about something using careful methods )has any study assessed the merits of the two schools?
question the merits of something(= not be sure if something is a good idea )people began to question the merits of nuclear energy.
see little/no merit in something(= think that something is not a good idea )i can see no merit in violence.
have its merits(= have some good qualities )each idea has its merits.
artistic merit(= the qualities that make something good as a piece of art )what are the artistic merits of this statue?
literary merit(= the qualities that make something good as a book, play, or poem )there was no literary merit in his poems.
great meritit seems to me that the idea has great merit.
outstanding merit(= very great merit )the prize is given to students of outstanding merit.
considerable merit(= a lot of merit )there is considerable merit in using this kind of approach.
the relative/comparative merits of something(= the good qualities of something as compared to something else )she is an expert in the relative merits of spa waters.

children.name: plus b2
children.definition: plus informal an additional quality that helps to make something more useful, valuable, or attractive than other things of the same type:điểm cộng
examples: be a plus:
▪ the hotel’s closeness to the beach is definitely a plus:
major/definite/big etc plus
some knowledge of spanish is a definite plus in this job.
plus pointbritish
▪ the plus point of this area is its school system, which is considered one of the best in the city:

children.name: beauty x
children.definition: the beauty of a particularly good quality that makes sth especially useful, suitable, or likely to be successful: ưu điểm, cái hay, ..
examples: that’s the beauty of itspoken :
our new generator runs entirely on recycled fuel. that’s the beauty of it:
the beauty of sth is thatused when you want to emphasize that something has a very good or useful feature :
the beauty of the plan is that it is so simple.
the beauty of the plan is that it only requires a small investment:

children.name: the only good feature of sth
saving grace x
children.definition: saving grace/ˌseɪvɪŋ ˈgreɪs/  a good quality that something or someone has that stops them from being completely bad: mỗi một cái, mỗi một điểm tốt
examples: the film'sonly/onesaving grace is the excellent photography.
▪ i can’t really play baseball. my one saving grace is that i can pitch:
▪ i hate this house. its only saving grace is that it’s near the centre of town:

children.name: redeeming feature x
children.definition: redeeming feature the one good quality that sb/sth has that saves it from being completely bad, useless, or unacceptable:điểm tốt bù lại
examples: the heroine of the novel is cruel and evil, with no redeeming features:
coal is relatively expensive but its redeeming feature is that it is in plentiful supply:

children.name: the good and bad feature of sth
advantages and disadvantages b1
children.definition: advantages and disadvantages the good and bad features of sth - use this especially when you are comparing what is good and what is bad about something: ưu nhược điểm
examples: ▪ being an only child has both advantages and disadvantages:
the advantages and disadvantages of something:
▪ the advantages and disadvantages of owning a car in the city:
weigh the advantages and disadvantages of somethingto consider the advantages and disadvantages of something :
▪ politicians should carefully weigh the advantages and disadvantages of committing us troops to this conflict:

children.name: the pros and cons b2
children.definition: the pros and cons the advantages and disadvantages of something that you need to think aboutin order to make a decision:lợi ích và tác hại,cái lợi cái hại
examples: the pros and cons of
▪ there has been a lot of discussion about the pros and cons of making certain types of drugs legal:
▪ your doctor should explain the pros and cons of the different treatments available:
weigh up the pros and consthink about the advantages and disadvantages :
▪ karen and david weighed up the pros and cons of having another child and decided against it.:

children.name: the pluses and minuses b2
children.definition: the pluses and minuses the advantages and disadvantages of something such as a plan or method that you consider before you do something, or that you notice after it has been done:điểm cộng điểm trừ
examples: the pluses and minuses of
▪ she talked about some of the pluses and minuses of being self-employed:

children.name: sth make you likely to be successful
advantage b1
children.definition: advantage something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having thisopp disadvantage: lợi thế
examples: advantage over
her experience meant that she had a big advantage over her opponent.
younger workers tend tobe at an advantage(= have an advantage )when applying for jobs.
it mightbe to your advantage(= it might help you )to take a computer course of some kind.
have an advantage(alsoenjoy an advantageformal)our parents didn’t have all the advantages that we have.|western countries enjoyed considerable advantages in terms of technology.
get/gain an advantageboth teams tried to get an advantage.
give sb an advantagehis height gives him a big advantage.
work to your advantage(= make you have an advantage – often used when this is unexpected )sometimes a lack of experience can work to your advantage.
see the advantage(= understand the advantage )i can see the advantage of living near the station.
a big/great/massive/huge advantageit’s a great advantage to be able to speak some spanish.
a slight advantage(= a small one )karpov enjoyed a slight advantage over his opponent.
an unfair advantagecompanies that receive government subsidies have an unfair advantage.
a definite/distinct advantage(= one that you can clearly notice )electronic trading has a number of distinct advantages.
a real advantage(= a definite advantage )the new system has some real advantages.
an added advantage(= an extra advantage )candidates with experience in sales and marketing would have an added advantage.
a political advantagerepublicans have a political advantage in most of those areas.
a military advantagethe military advantage had shifted towards the rebels.
a psychological advantagewinning the first game gives you a psychological advantage over your opponent.
the advantages and disadvantages of sththe advantages and disadvantages of living in a big city
the advantages outweigh the disadvantages(= the advantages are more valuable )when it comes down to working from home, you have to decide if the advantages outweigh the disadvantages.
common errors
►do not say 'a good advantage'. saya big advantageora real advantage.

children.name: asset c1
children.definition: asset something or someone that is useful because they help you succeed or deal with problemsopp liability: tài sản
examples: a sense of humor is a great asset in this business.
▪ a sense of humour is an important asset for any teacher.
be an asset to somebody/something
i think rachel would be an asset to the department.
▪ laney continues to be a great asset to the company:

children.name: privilege c1
children.definition: privilege/ˈprɪvɪlɪdʒ, ˈprɪvəlɪdʒ/  a special advantage or right thatonly a few people have,for example because their family is rich or because they have an important job:đặc lợi, đặc quyền
examples: ▪ foreign diplomats have all kinds of special privileges:
▪ countries within the european community grant certain commercial privileges to each other:
he had nospecial privilegesand was treated just like every other prisoner.
privilege of
the privilege of a good education
▪ not everyone has the privilege of a private education:

children.name: have an advantage b1
children.definition: have an advantage/hæv ən ədˈvɑːntɪdʒǁ-ˈvæn-/  to have something that makes you more likely to succeedthan other people:
examples: có lợi thế ( hơn so với mọi người )
▪ the american team seemed to have all the advantages - better training, better facilities, and much better financial support:
have an advantage over : có lợi thế hơn ai
▪ the winning boxer had an advantage over his opponent because he was several pounds heavier:

children.name: be at an advantage b1
children.definition: be at an advantage/biː ət ən ədˈvɑːntɪdʒǁ-ˈvæn-/  if someone is at an advantage, they have experience or qualities which make them more likely to succeed in doing something or more likely to do something well: có lợi thế ( để thành công , làm tốt việc gì )
examples: ▪ students with a strong math background will be at an advantage next year when the statistics course starts.
be at an advantage over
▪ children have several advantages over adults when it comes to learning another language:
distinct advantagedefinite advantage: lợi thế tuyệt đối
▪ mitchell’s height gives him a distinct advantage over the other players:

children.name: have a head start x
children.definition: have a head start/hæv ə ˌhed ˈstɑːʳt/  to have a big advantage over others in a particular activity, especially because you started doing it before them : có lợi thế ( hơn người khác vì làm trước đó)
examples: have a head start on: có lợi thế trong việc gì/điều gì
▪ the british have a head start on many other countries in areas such as genetic engineering.:
nước anh có lợi thế hơn so với các nước khác trong khu vực ví dụ như kĩ thuật di truyền
give somebody a head start: cho ai lợi thế
▪ sending your children to nursery school clearly gives them a head start.:
gửi con trẻ tới trường mẫu giáo rõ ràng đã cho chúng một lợi thế

children.name: have sth going for you x
children.definition: have everything going for you/hæv ˌevriθɪŋ ˈgəʊɪŋ fəʳ juː/  to have all thequalitiesthat are likely to make you succeed inwhateveryou decide to do:
examples: cómọi ưu thế , mọi thứ tốt đẹp cho mình
▪ she was bright and pretty and had everything going for her:
cô ấy thông minh và xinh đẹp và có mọi ưu thế cho mình.
▪ barry had everything going for him -- charm, looks, intelligence, but still he was unemployed:
barry có mọi thứ tốt đẹp cho anh ấy - sự quyến rũ, ngoại hình, thông minh nhưng anh ấy vẫn thất nghiệp.

children.name: have sth on your side x
children.definition: have youth/experience etc on your side/hæv ˈjuːθ ɒn jɔːʳ ˌsaɪd/  to have an advantage over others because you are young, have a lot of experience etc:
examples: có lợi thế trẻ hơn/ kinh nghiệm hơn ( người khác )
▪ he is a strong player but his opponent will have youth on his side:
anh ấy là một cầu thủ mạnh nhưng đối thủ của anh ấy có lợi thế trẻ hơn anh ấy.
▪ with knowledge of the company on her side, she was more likely to get the job than any of the external candidates:
với lợi thế là kiến thức về công ty của cô ấy, cô ấy dường như có khả năng có được công việc hơn bất cứ những ứng cử viên khác.

children.name: hold all the cards x
children.definition: hold all the cards/həʊld ˌɔːl ðə ˈkɑːʳdz/  to have all the advantages in a particular situation so that you can control what happens:
examples: nắm mọi lợi thế
▪ it seemed that he held all the cards and that there was nothing she could do but say ‘yes’:
dường như rằng anh ta nắm mọi lợi thế cho nên cô ấy đã không thể làm gì ngoại trừ nói "vâng"

children.name: have the upper hand c2
children.definition: have the upper hand/hæv ði ˌʌpəʳ ˈhænd/  to havemorepowerthan someone, especially someone who is fighting against you or who does not agree with you, so that you are likely to defeat them:
examples: có lợi thế quyền hành..
▪ although the rebels control areas in the south, the government still has the upper hand:
mặc dù phiến quân chiếm cứ vùng ở phía nam, chính phủ vẫn có quyền hành
have the upper hand against: có lợi thế/quyền hành chống lại ...
▪ police finally have the upper hand against the drug dealers in the area:
cảnh sát cuối cũng đã có đủ khả năng chống lại những kẻ bán thuốc phiện trong khu vực.

children.name: be in a strong position u
children.definition: be in a strong position/a position of strength/biː ɪn ə ˌstrɒŋ pəˈzɪʃən, ə pəˌzɪʃən əv ˈstreŋθǁ-ˌstrɔːŋ-/  to be in a position where you have an advantage over someone and are likely to win, especially indiscussionsto get something from them:
examples: có lợi thế cao hơn ( quyền hành, vị trí )
▪ the government claims that as long as they have nuclear weapons, they can negotiate from a position of strength:
chính phủ tuyên bố rằng miễn là họ có vũ khí hạt nhân, họ đều có thể có đàm phám với quyền hành lớn hơn
▪ at the end of the war, the us was in a strong position to influence the future of europe:
ở cuối trận chiến, quân đội mĩ đã chiếm lợi thế cao hơn làm ảnh hưởng đến tương lai của châu âu

children.name: the odds are stacked in sb’s favour x
children.definition: the odds are stacked in somebody’s favourbritish/
examples: the odds are stacked in somebody’s favoramerican /ði ˌɒdz ɑːʳ stækt ɪn somebodyˈs ˈfeɪvəʳǁ-ˌɑːdz-/ used to say that someone has a big advantage in a competition, election etc so that they are very likely to win:
có lợi thế hơn (có khả năng chiến thắng cao hơn trong cuộc thi đấu, bầu cử... )
▪ everyone knows that you can’t win at gambling because the odds are stacked in the dealer’s favour:
mọi người đều biết rằng anh có thể thắng trong canh bạc bởi vì anh có nhiều lợi thế hơn
▪ the odds were stacked in the labour party’s favour, so it was a great surprise when they were not elected:
đảng lao động có lợi thế chiến thắng hơn, cho nên điều mà họ không trúng cử đã gây ra sự ngạc nhiên lớn

children.name: give sb an advantage b1
children.definition: give somebody an advantage/ˌgɪv somebody ən ədˈvɑːntɪdʒǁ-ˈvæn-/  :
examples: cho ai một lợi thế
▪ the fact that liverpool had only ten men playing for them gave the other team an advantage:
việc mà liverpool chỉ có 10 thành viên trong đội chơi đã khiến cho những đội khác có được lợi thế
give sb an advantage over:cho ai một lợi thế hơn hẳn cho ai
▪ what gives the company an advantage over its competitors is its location:
điều mà cho công ty đó lợi thế hơn hẳn các nhà cạnh tranh khác chính là địa điểm của nó

children.name: give sb the edge c2
children.definition: give somebody the edge/ˌgɪv somebody ði ˈedʒ/  to give someone aslightadvantage, for example in a competition or election:
examples: cho ai một ít lợi thế
▪ his ten years’ experience will give him the edge in tomorrow’s fight:
kinh nghiệm 10 năm của anh ấy sẽ giúp anh ấy có được một ít lợi thế cho trận đấu ngày mai
give sb the edge over: có một ít lợi thế hơn
▪ he tried to find out as much as he could about the company, believing that it would give him the edge over the other interviewees:
anh ấy cố tìm ra càng nhiều thứ về công ty đó, anh tin rằng nó sẽ giúp anh ấy có lợi thế hơn những ứng cử viên khác

children.name: be to sb's advantage b1
children.definition: be to somebody’s advantage/biː tə somebodyˈs ədˈvɑːntɪdʒ ǁ -ˈvæn-/  if something is to your advantage, it will help you to succeed:
examples: có ích cho ai
▪ it will be to your advantage to start preparing for the exam now. don’t wait until the last minute:
điều đó sẽ có ích cho bạn khi bạn bắt đầu chuẩn bị cho bài kiểm tra ngay bây giờ. đừng đợi tới tận phút cuối cùng.
could/would/might be to somebody’s advantage:
có thể có ích cho ai
▪ i think you should accept steve’s offer to help you with the presentation -- it could be to your advantage:
tôi nghĩ anh nên chấp nhận lời đề nghị của steve muốn giúp buổi thuyết trình của anh - nó có thể rất có ích cho anh.

children.name: be in sb’s favour c1
children.definition: be in somebody’s favourbritish /be in somebody’s favoramerican /biː ɪn somebodyˈs ˈfeɪvəʳ/  if a situation or conditions are in someone’s favour, they will help that person succeed:
examples: với lợi thế dành cho ai, đặc ân cho ai
▪ investors are hoping that the new regulations will operate in their favor:
những nhà đầu tư đang hi vọng rằng những luật lệ mới sẽ mở ra những lợi thế cho họ.
tip the balance in somebody’s favourto give someone a slight advantage :
trao cho ai một ít quyền lợi/lợi thế/đặc ân
▪ it will be a closely fought match, but corgan’s greater physical strength is likely to tip the balance in his favour:
trận đấu sẽ kết thúc, nhưng lợi thế là corgan có thể lực tốt nên có thể anh ấy sẽ chiến thắng.

children.name: favour x
children.definition: favourbritish /favoramerican /ˈfeɪvəʳ/  if a situation or conditions such as the weather favour someone, they make that person more likely to succeedthan other people:
examples: ủng hộ , đem lại lợi thế cho ( ai hơn người khác )
▪ the weather favours the australians, who are used to playing in the heat:
thời tiết đã đem lại lợi thế cho người úc, họ đã quen với nhiệt độ cao.
▪ german negotiators denied that economic circumstances had favored their companies and given them an export advantage:
những cố vấn người đức đã phủ nhận tình trạng kinh tế đã đem lại lợi thế cho công ty của họ và cho họ lợi ích xuất khẩu.

children.name: virtue c2
children.definition: virtuean advantage that makes you believe that sth is a good thing : “đức tính” ưu điểm
examples: they believed in the virtues of culture, civilization, and reason.
he’s alwaysextolling the virtuesof hard work(= saying that hard work is a good thing ).
it always looks odd to see an actress on tv extollingthe virtues of washing-up liquid.
would there be any virtueintaking an earlier train?

children.name: edge c2
children.definition: edgenounadvantage
examples: [ s ] an advantage over other people
_in terms of experience, she definitelyhadthe edgeoverthe other people that we interviewed.

children.name: privileged c1
children.definition: privilegedadjective
examples: having a privilege
_as an ambassador, she enjoys a very privileged status.
_[ + to infinitive ]i have been privilegedtowork with the pioneers of silicon technology.

children.name: make the most of b2
children.definition: make the most ofsth
examples: to take full advantage of something because it may not last long
_it's a lovely day – we must make the most ofit.

children.name: pro b2
children.definition: pronounpluralprosadvantage
examples: an advantage or a reason for doing something
_one of the big prosofliving inmadridis the night life.
_we're just weighing up the prosand cons(= advantages and disadvantages) of moving to a bigger house.
